name: Largest Metadrome in Base N
description:
A `metadrome` is a number whose digits are in strictly increasing order.

In this task you are given a number `n` where `n >= 2`. You simply have to calculate the value of the largest metadrome which can be expressed in base `n`

For example:

`n = 4`  The largest metadrome is `123 (base 4) = 27 (decimal)`

`n = 16` The largest metadrome is `123456789abcdef (base 16) = 81985529216486895 (decimal)`

Values of `n` up to `10000` will be tested
